alert.note: Alert for Osborne (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 06 at 12:58AM CDT until June 08 at 9:46PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of north central Kansas, including the following counties, Osborne and Rooks. * WHEN...Until 300 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1256 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. No additional rainfall is expected. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Wolf Creek, Crooked Creek, Covert Creek, Paradise Creek, Jim Creek, Kill Creek, Lucky Creek, South Fork Solomon River, Boxelder Creek, Douglas Creek, Elm Creek, Medicine Creek and Eagle Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Natoma, Woodston and Alton.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
